channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: 'Dead cat hanging from a tree': Origin of Haitian immigrants row. Everyone heard it
item.description: Lee said she heard it from a neighbor (Kimberley Newton) who heard it from a friend who heard it from their daughter. The rumor was a cat owner found her dead pet hanging from a tree ready to be skinned, butchered and eaten at a house said to be occupied by Haitian immigrants. But both Lee and Kimberly were not sure about the authenticity of the rumor as they don't know the person who lost the cat.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US elections getting spicy after 'Loony' Loomer's curry jibe
item.description: Linda Loomer's provocative comments about Kamala Harris and curry have ignited controversy, prompting questions about Donald Trump's ties with her. Trump's remarks on illegal immigrants and Harris's visit to an anti-Trump spice store have further fueled the debate. Republican leaders are calling for Trump to distance himself from Loomer amid concerns over her influence.
item.dc:creator: Chidanand Rajghatta

item.title: Laura Loomer's photo with Donald Trump viral. People ask where's Melania, where's wedding ring
item.description: As photos of Laura Loomer with Donald Trump went viral amid a major controversy over Loomer's role in Donald Trump's campaign, people asked why Laura and Trump were so closely standing. Social media users asked where Melania Trump was and why Donald Trump was not wearing his wedding ring. Donald Trump, however, never wore any wedding ring or band.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Unruly Australian passenger asked to pay $11,780 for fuel cost as flight had to turn around
item.description: A Western Australian passenger has been fined $11,780 after his disruptive behavior forced a Jetstar flight from Perth to Sydney to return. The incident led to the cancellation of the flight and overnight accommodation for passengers. The man pleaded guilty to disorderly behavior and failing to comply with safety instructions.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Despite debate win, Kamala Harris makes no dent in battleground state although 5+ nationwide
item.description: Kamala Harris experienced a minor poll increase after her debate with Donald Trump, yet the Presidential race stays competitive in key battleground states. Both resumed campaigning; Harris was buoyed by favorable reviews while Trump declined another debate challenge, insisting on his victory despite mixed reactions to his performance.
item.dc:creator: Chidanand Rajghatta

item.title: Haitian row: Photographer of viral 'man carrying duck' says he thought it was...
item.description: The man who took the viral photo of a man carrying a duck came forward and claimed that the photo was not from Springfield but from Ohio's Columbus. He said he regrets posting the photo on Reddit as it became the weapon of the Right-wingers to spread the malicious rumors about Haitian immigrants. He said he posted the photo as he thought it was not something one gets to see every day.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: John Legend says 'nobody eating cats' in Ohio's Springfield: 'I am from there'
item.description: Singer John Legend said he was born in Ohio's Springfield and knows the demography well enough to confirm that nobody is eating cats and dogs there. The Haitians migrated and settled in Springfield because they found jobs there and immigrants in the US generally do well, they are hard working, John Legend said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Laura Loomer doubles down on Kamala Harris, calls her 'evil bimbo': 'Respect is earned'
item.description: Facing flak for her racist attack on Kamala Harris, Laura Loomer Friday did not take a step back. She insisted that she considers Kamala Harris as an evil bimbo who is not eligible to be the president. The conspiracy theorist, in her latest X post, also suggested that Joe Biden-Kamala Harris administration incited the assassination attempt of Donald Trump.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Stormy Daniels says Trump never wanted to be president, he wants...
item.description: Stormy Daniels fears that Donald Trump might charge her with treason if he is re-elected, following her testimony against him in the hush-money case. But her feelings towards Trump are somewhat complex, she said. She hates Donald Trump but does not think that Trump also hates her. But she's certain that Trump hates the situation that she has put him in.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Did Biden ask for the Trump cap? Viral video answers it wasn't offered to him
item.description: At a 9/11 anniversary event in Pennsylvania, President Joe Biden donned a Trump 2024 cap as a gesture of unity. A viral video shows him interacting with a Trump supporter, exchanging hats, and making humorous remarks. The White House clarified that the act aimed to symbolize national unity.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Haitian immigrant pet-eating row: Ohio woman accused of eating cat is US citizen; video is from Canton, not Springfield
item.description: A case where a woman allegedly killed and ate a cat has been wrongly linked to Haitian immigrants, causing political uproar. Authorities confirmed the accused is a US citizen with no immigrant connections. Despite this, Trump and Vance echoed these false claims, spreading misinformation and fueling controversy.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Kamala Harris campaign calls Trump a ‘chicken’ after he backs out of third debate
item.description: Donald Trump announced there would be no third debate with Kamala Harris, leading to mockery from her campaign and social media users. Trump cited his previous debate performance as a reason for his decision, while criticizing Harris and Joe Biden. This move sparked widespread ridicule and raised questions about his commitment to future debates.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Prince Harry’s 40th: ‘Completely isolated’ and ‘No sign of an official role in Royal family’ — What’s next for the Duke?
item.description: Prince Harry's 40th birthday highlights growing rifts with the UK public and his family. Residing in California with Meghan Markle and their children, he is distanced from his royal roots. Tensions have escalated since stepping back from royal duties, leaving reconciliation prospects dim as both sides navigate their strained relationship.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Indian-origin ex-South African finance minister Pravin Gordhan dies at 75 after battle with cancer
item.description: Pravin Gordhan, South Africa's former Finance Minister, has died at age 75 from cancer. A key political figure since the nation's democratic transition in 1994, he held numerous important roles. President Cyril Ramaphosa expressed sorrow over his death, commending Gordhan's integrity and service to the country.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Prince Harry set to pocket £7 million on his 40th birthday tax-free! Here's how he escapes HMRC
item.description: Prince Harry is about to receive £7 million from the late Queen Mother's trust fund without incurring inheritance tax, thanks to strategic financial planning. His share exceeds Prince William's due to the Royal Family's financial structure, which ensures efficient wealth transfer across generations.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Russia accuses 6 British officials of 'spying and subversive activities', expels them
item.description: The Russian FSB has accused six British diplomats of espionage, resulting in their expulsion and revocation of accreditation. This development occurs during UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer's visit to Washington for talks with President Joe Biden about Ukraine. The FSB claims the diplomats were involved in intelligence gathering and subversive activities against Russia.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Germany fact-checks Trump amid energy policy debate: 'PS: We also don't eat cats and dogs'
item.description: Germany has rebutted former President Donald Trump's claims about its renewable energy system, stating that over 50% of its energy comes from renewables. The country is shutting down coal and nuclear plants, aiming to phase out coal by 2038 and achieve majority renewable energy consumption by 2050. Germany also addressed misinformation with facts.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump's 'Haitians are eating dogs. They are eating the cats' claim inspires viral TikTok song, internet reacts
item.description: Donald Trump's false statement during a presidential debate that Haitian immigrants in Springfield, Ohio, were eating pets has gone viral. Debunked by ABC moderator David Muir, the claim was initially spread by JD Vance. This has led to a TikTok trend and memes focusing on The Simpsons' fictional hometown.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who was Kristina Joksimovic? Former Miss Switzerland finalist whose husband 'pureed' her chopped body parts using hand blender
item.description: Kristina Joksimovic, a former Miss Switzerland finalist, was murdered by her husband in Binningen, Switzerland. He confessed to the crime after initially claiming self-defense. The court ruling revealed shocking details of the murder and rejected his appeal for release. The crime has left their two daughters without their mother.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Georgia shool shooting: GBI reveals shocking new details from Apalachee high attack - '14-year-old managed to conceal weapon inside ...'
item.description: The Georgia Bureau of Investigation has unveiled details regarding the Apalachee High School shooting where 14-year-old Colt Gray killed two students and two teachers. Both Colt and his father, Colin Gray, face charges. This is the first instance in Georgia where a parent is charged in connection with a school shooting.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
